body:
In Win64bit,s Python 2.7, Anaconda, 

1) In a_cython.py File,
```
def fun_cython(a):
 b=a
 for i in xrange(0, 100000):
    a += i + b
 print a
```

2) In   a_cython.pxd file, same directory than previous one :
```
import cython

@cython.locals(b = cython.int, i = cython.int)
@cython.boundscheck(False) # turn off bounds-checking for entire function
@cython.wraparound(False)  # turn off negative index wrapping for entire function
cdef int fun_cython( int a)
```



3) In test_cython.py file, the test code :
```
import pyximport; pyximport.install(build_dir= 'aapackage/')
import a_cython as acy
acy.fun_cython(5.6)

import a_cython 
print(a_cython.__file__) 

Out:   \aapackage\a_cython.pyc
```

It seems that PyxImport does not compile the  a_cython.pxd

1) How to force the compilation ?
title: Pyximport Bug in Python 2.7
